result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacquelyn C. Soldner was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive to sentence imposed in 15CF21. Defendant is entitled to 41 days presentence credit.
Consecutive to: sentence imposed in 15C21.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of Extended Supervision. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of release.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Case called along with 15CF21.  Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with her attorney William Mayer.  The State filed Amended Informations for each case.   Ct. reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea in Case No. 15CF21 Guilty to OWI-6th with the Minor Passenger Enhancer being dismissed. and also heard her plea in Case No. 15CF38 of Guilty to OWI-7th with the Minor Passenger Enhancer being dismissed.  Court found probable cause for each case.  Ct. found her pleas were given FKVI, accepted both pleas, and found Def. guilty of the charge(s) stated above. Based upon her pleas to these two charges, Count 2 in 15CF21 is dismissed and Count 2 in 15CF38 is also dismissed.  In 15CF38, the Court ordered Counts 3, 4, and 5 are DRI.  Ct. found factual basis for each case and they are to be considered 6th and 7th offenses.  BAC in 15CF21 was .379% and in 15CF38, her BAC was .101%.   Ct. heard from State and Defense and sentenced as follows:
As to 15CF21: 
54 mos in the WI DOC:  18 months IC, 36 months ES, consecutive to any prior sentence, with VIP as part of extended supervision; absolute sobriety, no bars, liquor stores, and must have a valid presc. for any drug use 
Fine of $2,400
Court costs 
$26 for the blood draw fee
AODA/followthrough 
36 mos. revocation of DL
36 mos. of IIL 
Driver Improvement Surcharge 
5 days presentence credit 

As to 15CF38:
72 months in the WI DOC: 36 months IC, 36 months ES consecutive to any prior sentence, with a VIP as part of extended supervision; absolute sobriety, no bars, liquor stores, and must have a valid precr. for any drug use
NO FINE
Court costs 
$26 for the blood draw
36 mos. revocation of DL
36 mos. of IIL 
AODA/followthrough 
Driver Improvement Surcharge 
41 days presentence credit

Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program 
Cash bail to be applied towards fines, blood draws and costs
BAC
Status conference on May 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Acknowledgement by Person Posting Bail/Deposit

  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 12:45 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15CF21 & 38 - Defendant, Jacquelyn C. Soldner in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Defendant not eligible for SPD. Discussion held on Petition. Court heard; finds eligible for court appointed counsel and appoints Atty Bill Mayer at rate of $50/bi-weekly commencing 2/20/15 and bi-weekly as paid. Discussion held on PH. Def waives time limits. Court reschedules PH.

15CF21 & 15CF38: Defendant Jacquelyn C. Soldner in court, in custody.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. has not been able to retain counsel on her own; Court will not appoint today - Def. has to apply with SPD and fill out financial form; Court resets to next week in Br. 1

Case called along with 15CF21.  Defendant Jacquelyn C. Soldner in court, in custody, without counsel.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  She stated her husband is searching for an attorney.  PE's are set.  A forfeiture hearing is also scheduled for tomorrow.  Court ordered continuances for both PE's for two weeks.

Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on February 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:45) Defendant Jacquelyn C. Soldner in custody via video with Intern Austin Heimann (Atty. Moeller) (jail only).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $150,000 Cash bail w/conditions; Def. just appeared last Monday on same charges; Intern Heiman response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 2/12/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 4 & Review Hearing 2/11/15 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $50,000.00 CASH BOND with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
State notes that they will be requesting cash bail posted in 14CF21 be forfeited and be held pending hearing; Court so orders and orders motion to be filed within 48 hours
